intro: Phymosia umbellata, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in dense, spherical clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Phymosia umbellata is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
